DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the status of the of T-cell engraftment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A thymocyte-derived lymphocyte of immunological importance that is long-lived (months to years) and is responsible for cell-mediated immunity. T lymphocyte cells form rosettes with sheep erythrocytes and, in the presence of transforming agents (mitogens), differentiate and divide. These cells have the characteristic T3 surface marker and may be further divided into subsets according to function, such as helper, cytotoxic, etc._Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs._The establishment of viable, functional grafted tissue within the body of a host.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One type of white blood cell that attacks virus-infected cells, foreign cells, and cancer cells.  T cells also produce a number of substances that regulate the immune response.

Concepts.definition: A thymocyte-derived lymphocyte of immunological importance that is long-lived (months to years) and is responsible for cell-mediated immunity. T lymphocyte cells form rosettes with sheep erythrocytes and, in the presence of transforming agents (mitogens), differentiate and divide. These cells have the characteristic T3 surface marker and may be further divided into subsets according to function, such as helper, cytotoxic, etc.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.:The establishment of viable, functional grafted tissue within the body of a host.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.
The establishment of viable, functional grafted tissue within the body of a host.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs._The establishment of viable, functional grafted tissue within the body of a host._A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.: An organism that nourishes and supports another but does not benefit by the association; recipient of transplanted tissue or organ from a donor.

Concepts.definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
An organism that nourishes and supports another but does not benefit by the association; recipient of transplanted tissue or organ from a donor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Involving or composed of different kinds.: The occurrence in an individual of two or more cell populations of different chromosomal constitutions, derived from different individuals. This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual.

Concepts.definition: Involving or composed of different kinds.

The occurrence in an individual of two or more cell populations of different chromosomal constitutions, derived from different individuals. This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organism that nourishes and supports another but does not benefit by the association; recipient of transplanted tissue or organ from a donor.: Lymphoid cells concerned with humoral immunity. They are short-lived cells resembling bursa-derived lymphocytes of birds in their production of immunoglobulin upon appropriate stimulation.: Detected; perceived or discerned.

Concepts.definition: An organism that nourishes and supports another but does not benefit by the association; recipient of transplanted tissue or organ from a donor.

Immunologically important lymphocyte that is not thymus-dependent, is either short-lived and naive or long-lived and of memory phenotype, and resembles the bursa-derived lymphocyte of birds in that it is responsible for the production of immunoglobulins.
Detected; perceived or discerned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organism that nourishes and supports another but does not benefit by the association; recipient of transplanted tissue or organ from a donor.: One type of white blood cell that attacks virus-infected cells, foreign cells, and cancer cells.  T cells also produce a number of substances that regulate the immune response.: Detected; perceived or discerned.

Concepts.definition: An organism that nourishes and supports another but does not benefit by the association; recipient of transplanted tissue or organ from a donor.

A thymocyte-derived lymphocyte of immunological importance that is long-lived (months to years) and is responsible for cell-mediated immunity. T lymphocyte cells form rosettes with sheep erythrocytes and, in the presence of transforming agents (mitogens), differentiate and divide. These cells have the characteristic T3 surface marker and may be further divided into subsets according to function, such as helper, cytotoxic, etc.
Detected; perceived or discerned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual.

A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).

To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

The occurrence in an individual of two or more cell populations of different chromosomal constitutions, derived from different individuals. This contrasts with mosaicism in which the different cell populations are derived from a single individual.
